name: Bhai Parmukh
excerpt: Bhai Parmukh is recognized as a kirtani (Sikh hymn singer) who played a role in popularizing Sikh hymns through devotional music and kirtan performances. Limited historical records are available, suggesting he was active in the modern era of Sikhism, contributing to the dissemination of Gurbani through singing.

biographySections.label: Contributions/Service
biographySections.value: Bhai Parmukh is noted for his efforts in popularizing Sikh hymns (kirtan), making Gurbani accessible to wider audiences through live performances and recordings. In the modern context, kirtanis like him helped bridge traditional Sikh worship with contemporary settings, performing in gurdwaras, samagams (religious gatherings), and possibly early radio broadcasts or community events. His service likely involved teaching aspiring singers and preserving the melodic structures (raags) prescribed by the Sikh Gurus for hymn recitation. This contributed to the cultural preservation of Sikh music during times of social change, such as post-partition India or global Sikh diaspora expansion.

spiritualLegacy.description: Bhai Parmukh's legacy lies in elevating kirtan as a medium for spiritual connection, embodying the Sikh principle of Naam Simran (remembrance of the divine through music). His work reinforced the idea that music is a path to enlightenment, as emphasized by Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism.
